00039 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00040 {
00041     if(argc < 3)
00042     {
00043         printUsage();
00044         exit(1);
00045     }
00046 
00047     Knowledge::EncodeType encode = Knowledge::ENCODE_TYPE_EUCJP;
00048 
00049     const char* srcDir;
00050     const char* destDir;
00051     srcDir = destDir = 0;
00052 
00053     if(argc == 5)
00054     {
00055         if(strcmp(argv[1], "--encode") != 0)
00056         {
00057             cerr << "unknown command option " << argv[1] << endl;
00058             printUsage();
00059             exit(1);
00060         }
00061 
00062         encode = Knowledge::decodeEncodeType(argv[2]);
00063         if(encode == Knowledge::ENCODE_TYPE_NUM)
00064         {
00065             cerr << "unknown encode type " << argv[2] << endl;
00066             printUsage();
00067             exit(1);
00068         }
00069 
00070         srcDir = argv[3];
00071         destDir = argv[4];
00072     }
00073     else if(argc == 3)
00074     {
00075         srcDir = argv[1];
00076         destDir = argv[2];
00077     }
00078     else
00079     {
00080         cerr << "The number of command options is wrong." << endl;
00081         printUsage();
00082         exit(1);
00083     }
00084 
00085     // create knowledge
00086     JMA_Factory* factory = JMA_Factory::instance();
00087     Knowledge* knowledge = factory->createKnowledge();
00088 
00089     // encoding
00090     int r = knowledge->encodeSystemDict(srcDir, destDir, encode);
00091 
00092     delete knowledge;
00093 
00094     // print result
00095     if(r == 1)
00096     {
00097         cout << "succeeded";
00098     }
00099     else
00100     {
00101         cout << "failed";
00102     }
00103     cout << " in encoding from " << srcDir << " to " << destDir << endl;
00104 
00105     return 0;
